title: Why did I get perma-banned. What did I do riot. Please explain, LoL enforcers.
body: Alright, so I got done with a game, and I was having a good time, had a little verbal disagreement in game, and then I get a message, saying I got permanently suspended for "extreme nature of toxic behavior". My account has been banned once for 14 days, and I do have some history of toxic behavior, but me and a teammate of mine got into a verbal disagreement, he complained I didn't leash, I got mad at him because he started getting toxic with me, and then I get permanently suspended? League of Legends enforcers, please explain why this happened. I'm really confused.

replies.body:
Because you ignored the warnings of your previous 5 penalties.

If you have a question about the chat logs, post them here and I'd be happy to comment.

You are responsible for your own behavior.  Your teammate is responsible for theirs.

Let's try that scenario with a slightly different response:

Your teammate complains about not getting a leash.  You mute him.  You no longer see *his* toxic behavior and can focus on winning your lane.  Maybe he starts complaining in /all chat, but your opponents are more likely to think "What a jerk" about his comments and report him (not you), especially if they see no response to it from you.

He tries to report you, but you've muted him and kept your chat clean with everyone else, so the report gets thrown out.  You report him (along with anyone else he's annoyed) and he's the one who will get in trouble.

Wow I never seen someone scream in All chat and your team says, "What a jerk". I almost always agree with the Flamer, because 70% of the player base does not mute people.  Tilting is the #2 way to win a game outside of skill. But I can see the point of the OP. I recently had a Yasuo spam KYS in chat and all chat. I think I replied KYS once in chat, and then decided I was better then him and not be toxic to him. I pissed him off more by agreeing with him.

wow i wonder why.

You are judged on your words when you're reported. It doesn't matter if others are toxic. All you can do is mute and report them at the end of the game. You cannot and should not try to take justice into your own hands.
You have a mute button. Arguments don't really help.

Posting the chat logs would be the best way to find out exactly what was the source.
You'll find the chat logs by trying to log in.

As others have stated, you'll need to be extremely careful after a 14-day ban.

After someone gets off of a 14 day ban they have got to be super careful, the next punishment is always a perma. Obviously you weren't careful enough to reign in your anger and Riot to the only step that was left.

You answered your own question. You have a history of toxic behavior and you mad in game at someone, so you get banned. It doesn't matter who did it first.
Perma bans can only occur after multiple punishments, so you probably got off of a 14 day ban somewhat recently.
If you've already been banned for two weeks, then the next punishment is a perma. If that teammate reported you, its very likely you were banned due to the "little verbal disagreement".
